description: We are the only crime tour in Canada hosted by former Detectives. Let us share our direct knowledge of the city's secrets, since we know these streets like no other tour guide. From the Upper Canada Rebellion to the serial killer who struck fear in the LGBT community, we reveal many crimes and tales which shocked-yet also shaped- Toronto.

reviews.title: It would be a crime to miss this tour!
text: I recently took part in this tour, and wanted to share my experience with you.  It just so happened that I was the only one taking part in today's tour, but both guides very kindly went ahead with it.
The tour covers a fair amount of ground, literally and figuratively!  Obviously, you will need a comfortable pair of shoes for the walk, but the distance should be ok for most people to handle.

I have to admit, although I have a strong interest in true crime, I hadn't heard of a lot of the cases featured.  For obvious reasons, some of the details can be very upsetting, so please be prepared for this.  Having said that, there are some more light-hearted moments - a fight involving circus clowns, for one!  It was also very interesting to hear how some of these crimes had a beneficial effect on police work and ended up benefitting the community as a result.

Both guides had themselves several years' experience in the police, and this gave an extra dimension to some of the stories.  It must be a pretty tough job at times!   I can really recommend this tour - the amount of detail and the cases covered provide a fascinating insight into the dark side of Toronto.

reviews.title: Well worth it
text: Phil was a very knowledgeable and entertaining speaker. He answered all kinds of extra questions, walked at a good pace , and told us some great stories about the crime history of Toronto.

reviews.title: An informative and educational tour
text: This is an excellent tour and I highly recommend it.  Bob and Phil were full of details about past and present crimes, how they were dealt with and the impact on policing.  Not only was the tour interesting but we also learned a lot.  Not a lot of walking (this was their longest tour) and very informative stops.  Saw some places in Toronto (Courthouse Square) that we did not even know existed.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable and interesting!!
text: Great day yesterday. Bob and Phil were very informative and fun. Would recommend this tour!! Something a wee bit different.

reviews.title: Bob Knows True Crime
text: My wife loves true crime and for our visit this was at the top of our list.

We had Bob as our tour guide for the West End tour and it was nice that it was a smaller tour than some of the others we have done in the city. Bob, being retired from a 30~ year police career really kept the tour engaging. We really enjoyed our tour and tried hard to squeeze in another tour before we left, but it looks like it will be added for another trip for us.
If you enjoy true crime, not the gore, and facts about the criminal justice system, then this tour is for you.

reviews.title: BETTER THAN FICTION
text: The detectives were very personable and interesting.  Everyone in the group was riveted to the stories, many of which made headlines locally, nationally and internationally.  Best 2-hour tour I've taken and a great way to spend a sunny summer afternoon.  Can't wait to book my next tour.

reviews.title: Crime Tour
text: Great experience my 15 year old son loved it. Great history and first hand knowledge of the crimes and how they affected Toronto culture. They should have these in every city. Would highly recommend!

reviews.title: Captivating crimes and punishments that shaped Toronto through the decades
text: Bob was a knowledgeable and FUN guide! Taking this tour optimized our time in the city afterwards as we got to know a bit about many different neighborhoods and hear history from a unique perspective of crime and how it changed Toronto.

reviews.title: Great tour, highly recommend!
text: Very knowledgeable, super interesting, and kept it fun! Covered a lot of unique crimes and details. Would highly recommend!

reviews.title: A must do Toronto event!
text: This tour puts a unique spin on knowing Toronto a little better! Tour guides, Phil and Bob, were great making the tour not just informative but also a lot of fun with their insight as former detectives. Highly recommeded! A must do Toronto event whether you reside in Toronto or are visiting the city.

reviews.title: Interesting , the good and bad of local history
text: Very well done .  Interesting local stories.  Some of which I remember happening and forgot about.  Educational and recommend this tour if you are interested in first hand crime stories.   Thank you for your tine and expertise

reviews.title: Fascinating and Unique Walking Tour!
text: I do a lot of walking tours, but Toronto Crime Tours was my first true crime tour and my first tour led by former detectives! We really enjoyed the guides’ personal stories of working in policing. We also really appreciated the tone of the tour - it was fun and sometimes even funny, but did not sensationalize crime or murder. Instead, the guides used each story to explain how it shaped the history of the city, from the 1800s all the way up until the present day. They also addressed some tough topics, like the relationship between crime and mental health care. The downtown tour lasted over two hours and covered a lot of ground - make sure you wear comfortable shoes! - but I would definitely recommend it to everyone, especially if you love walking tours, true crime, or local history. Thanks Bob and Phil for an amazing morning! I can’t wait to do one of your other tours very soon.

reviews.title: Professional, entertaining and fascinating!  100 percent recommended!
text: For starters.  Yes absolutely this was a great tour and I would highly recommend it.  I've lived in Toronto for almost all of 45 years and still learned things on this tour.  The guides are coming with lots of personal experience and not only spoke about the crimes but also their impact on life in Toronto nowadays.  We were also impressed with how tactful they were in discussing topics with full understanding of the sensitive nature of the issues in terms of law enforcement and marginalized communities.  Really really great!

reviews.title: It’s a crime if you miss this tour!
text: The two pillars of a great tour are that they be entertaining and informative. On that basis this crime tour is a grand slam. The two officers present insights that only former detectives could have. And they aren't shy about admitting that in  some cases the police made mistakes, but these mistakes led to positive changes in investigative procedures. The interaction of the tour guides provides an almost theatrical experience. We can't wait to attend their other tours. Thanks for a great experience. Tom and Sharon Scanlan

reviews.title: For the faint of heart!
text: Bring comfy shoes! The walking tour takes approx. 10,000 steps with 1 bathroom break. Phil & Bob along with their witty story telling and respect to the sensitivity of the crimes told, I felt this tour captured a wide variety in types of crimes played out in Toronto. The tour started in front of the Roots store outside of the Eaton's Center (250 Yonge St), and ended in Courthouse Square Park (10 Court St). It would have been nice to end the tour where we started - especially if you're not Toronto savvy, and also if you're in a rush to add more $$ to your meter. I recommend booking this tour on a Sunday - less traffic in the city, cheaper parking! All in all, a great day full of facts. If you're a true crime junkie, you will still get the great experience because you can visually see where some of these crimes were handled. Definitely will be returning for the short 1hr tour from the Distillery District to the Flat Iron Building.

reviews.title: A living cop show.
text: This tour was exactly what we hoped it would be. My wife and I love cop shows. And here we were with two cops who knew all about Toronto crime. They took us to where they happened and gave us the background on them. And it spanned historically from the 1800s right up to the present day. We took the downtown tour and we’ll be taking the west end tour next. It was worth every penny.

reviews.title: Absolute blast! Taking serious matters, making them fun and educational while also giving closure.
text: Absolute blast! Taking the murders, mental health incidents and riots that happened in the city and presenting it in a fun yet educational way. As a Toronto native, even a couple stories I knew were given new details and perspective. The tour guide are so easy going, fun to talk to and clearly love what they do. Also a great way to make friends! Would highly recommend to anyone, and once they open more tours up I’ll be booking right away.

reviews.title: Two Hour Crime tour a very enjoyable time.
text: We were a party of 4 included in a group of 18 for the two hour Toronto Crime tour on a Sunday afternoon. We started right on schedule. The tour was very enjoyable, informative, our group moved well from one point of interest to the next considering the size of our group. Bob and Phil were personable, knowledgeable and mixed humour with the darker side of Toronto crime and it was a great way to see the inner core of Downtown Toronto. We knew some of the stories and learned so much more. I would highly recommend the tour and our little group are looking forward to more of the crime tours with Officers (retired) Bob and Phil. Keep up the good work fellas!

reviews.title: A really pleasant way to hear about Toronto’s darker side
text: My husband and I joined the afternoon downtown tour and thoroughly enjoyed a really pleasant 2 hours. We live in Toronto and are familiar with some of the cases presented but had no idea the impact the crimes had on current day policing or policies. Both Bob and Phil are great storytellers, engaging and informative. We would certainly recommend this tour for visitors to Toronto or native Torontonians who wish to learn more about our city’s history. We will definitely be signing up for the east end tour, we really enjoyed Bob and Phil’s stories, history telling and company, great job!

reviews.title: So much fun!!
text: Phil and Bob are amazing tour guides. The tour was interesting and informative. We had so much fun learning about downtown. Phil and Bob answered all of our questions and were super knowledgeable about Toronto's crime history. I would definitely recommend this tour to everyone!
